a prediction for the contact that was reported in Fig. 1 of Ref. [5]. This prediction consists
of the BCS limit, interpolation of Monte Carlo data near unitarity, and the BEC limit for a
trapped gas at zero temperature and uses a local density approximation.
Remarkably, the Tan relations predict that the contact, as revealed in probes of the
microscopic behavior of the gas, is directly connected to the thermodynamics of the gas. To
test the Tan relations, we measure the potential energy and release energy of the cloud. The
